title: Performance Guarantees for Subdivision Construction in Acton

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Performance Guarantees for Subdivision Construction in Acton
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

For each of the Subdivisions listed below, please provide:

(1)	A copy of the subdivision surety provided under G.L. c.41 §81U (performance guarantee, e.g. bond, restrictive covenant, etc.) and any amendments thereof;
(2)	Every written request to extend the completion date specified within the subdivision surety;
(3)	Every written request for partial release of the subdivision surety, and records of the granting of any such requests;
(4)	Every written request for final release of the subdivision surety, with all accompanying documentation, and records of receipt of such requests by (i) the Acton Planning Board and (ii) the Acton Town Clerk;
(5)	Any written certification by the Town of Acton that the principal has completed all obligations specified in the surety;
(6)	A record authorizing the final release of the subdivision security.


List of Subdivisions:

PB 13-05, “The Residences at Constitution Drive”
PB 14-03, “Roosevelt Drive”
PB 14-04, “Hayward Farm”
PB 15-07, “Jaime’s Way & Thomas Drive”
PB 16-10, “Mohegan Lane”
PB 16-15, “Summer Place”
PB 16-19, “Kellev’s Corner Southeast Lots”
PB 17-08, “Laurentide Circle”
PB 18-03, “180 Newtown Road PCRC”
PB 18-05, “110 Nagog Hill Road”
PB 19-04 “96 Newtown Road/Dylan Place”
PB 19-06, “Pond View Way”
PB 19-10, “Diplatzi Place”
PB 20-02, “The Preserve at Audubon Hill”
PB 21-02, “Amanda Lane”
PB 21-03, “Grassy Pond Way”
PB 21-07, “Hawk’s Crest Reserve”
PB 22-07, “Timber Way”

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous
